home.uploadGallerySub: Choose an existing photo to analyze

encyclopedia.title: Insect Encyclopedia
encyclopedia.subtitle: Browse through {{count}} major orders of insects

historyScreen.title: Analysis History
historyScreen.subtitle: {{count}} identification
historyScreen.emptyText: Take a photo or upload an image from the home screen to start identifying insects.
historyScreen.clearAllMsg: This will permanently delete all identification records.

detail.idTipText: For the best identification results, photograph the insect from directly above in good lighting. Try to include distinctive features like wings, antennae, and leg structure.

permissions.title: Permission Required
permissions.camera: Camera access is needed to identify insects.
permissions.gallery: Photo library access is needed to identify insects.

beetles.name: Beetles
beetles.description: The largest order of insects with hardened forewings

butterflies.name: Butterflies & Moths
butterflies.description: Scale-winged insects known for colorful patterns

ants.name: Ants, Bees & Wasps
ants.description: Social insects with complex colony structures

dragonflies.name: Dragonflies & Damselflies
dragonflies.description: Ancient predatory insects with remarkable flight

grasshoppers.name: Grasshoppers & Crickets
grasshoppers.description: Jumping insects known for their songs

sampleResults.name: Monarch Butterfly
sampleResults.habitat: Open fields, meadows, gardens across North America
sampleResults.diet: Nectar from milkweed and various flowers
characteristics: Distinctive orange and black wing pattern
Known for long-distance migration up to 3,000 miles
Toxic to predators due to cardenolide compounds
sampleResults.funFact: Monarchs are the only butterflies known to make a two-way migration, traveling up to 3,000 miles from North America to central Mexico.
